subject: PHAL: Clock error handling support
commitMessage:
PHAL: Clock error handling support

-Supporting new flag to indicate planar callout required
    -This flag can be set from either clock HWP error or clock
     non-HWP error.
-Adding new error type for ipl error callback
    -This error type can be called for non-hwp failures
    -Additional data sent will be parsed and included in PEL
-Different prefix is added for HWP error and PLAT error.
Tested:
"Primary SRC": {
    "Deconfigured":             "False",
    "Guarded":                  "False",
    "Error Details": {
        "Message":              "Failure occured during boot process"
    },
    "Callout Section": {
        "Callout Count":        "1",
        "Callouts": [{
            "FRU Type":         "Normal Hardware FRU",
            "Priority":         "Mandatory, replace all with this type as a unit",
            "Location Code":    "U780C.ND0.1234567-P0",
            "Part Number":      "F040221",
            "CCIN":             "2E33",
            "Serial Number":    "YL2E33010000"
        }]
    }
},
"User Data 1": {
    "Section Version": "1",
    "Sub-section type": "1",
    "Created by": "0x2000",

    "PLAT_FFDC_FAIL_TYPE": "STATUS_READ",
    "PLAT_FFDC_I2C_RC": "0",
    "PLAT_HW_CO_01_CALLOUT_PLANAR": "true",
    "PLAT_HW_CO_01_CLK_POS": "1",
    "PLAT_HW_CO_01_HW_ID": "PROC_REF_CLOCK",
    "PLAT_HW_CO_01_PRIORITY": "HIGH",
    "PLAT_RC": "10",
    "PLAT_RC_DESC": "Error in executing clock initialisation",
    "_PID": "21916"
},
"User Data 2": {
    "Section Version": "1",
    "Sub-section type": "1",
    "Created by": "0x2000",
    "Data": [
        {
            "Deconfigured": false,
            "Guarded": false,
            "InventoryPath": "/xyz/openbmc_project/inventory/system/chassis/motherboard",
            "Priority": "H"
        }
    ]
}

Signed-off-by: Rajees P P <rajerpp1@in.ibm.com>
Change-Id: Ifd2268b1c99be4dbfa9234e910d7e87771adb176

Change has been successfully merged by Jayanth Othayoth
shouldn;t this come from ipl code, so that here it is generic?
No, this cannot be achieved from ipl code, since planar is not modelled in device tree.

i think we have to remove these codes.
No need to callout the reference target implicitly.
If this is needed, then it would be there in CDG list
not sure
is it only for the non hardware procedure clock error handling?

Include "PHAL: " as prefix.

We are following that rule for phal specific code.
Done
this change is not specific to non-hwp error. Fixed the commit message
Looks commit message is not accurate as per the latest patch. Please update
Done

Tested:?
FYR:https://github.com/openbmc/docs/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#testing
Done
Where these is coming? I am not seeing the related code for this.

this is added as an ffdc_data in the structure returned from libipl

https://github.com/open-power/ipl/pull/22/files#diff-bd1ae5c8cc48843ac940e530861e80fd41620c108e1c19437eb39d825a3953d4R431
So, this is coming from the plat layer, right? The prefix `HWP_` will give confusion, right? can we change it to `PLAT_` i.e can we add that prefix based on the error code.
Done

Why RC is some different value? is it the correct one?
and RC_DESC is missing?
this rc indicates fapi2::FAPI2_RC_PLAT_ERR_SEE_DATA

Can you change it to a human-readable format? as like we did today for other RC with RC_DESC?
IMO, some numeric values won't help us while debugging by using the PEL, and also, no traces in this case.
Done

addPlanarCallout?

can you add documentation for this function?
Done
is it needed to get based on `xyz.openbmc_project.Inventory.Item.Board.Motherboard` instead of hard code?
this value is already hard coded in this repo.
CALLOUT_PLANAR?
Done
Do you think adding like LN434 will give more readable than 0/1?
Done

What will happen for other error cases?

If HwCallout is added without a planar callout request from the PHAL layer means, is it will break? 

Looks like you removed the old code which will callout the target by using the phal device tree so please include other error case test details in the commit message.

As per my understanding, hwcallout indicates we have to callout something other than FAPI targets.
Target passed inside this is, reference target which can be used to find the actual callout.
So, for other target type, (if it need to be supported), we may have to write custome code for each hw type.

I think callingout the reference target is not correct.
As we discussed, the reference target need not be called out.

Looks you are fixing some existing bugs i.e PHAL libekb FFDC.HWP_ErrorInfo.hwcallouts is originally not intended to callouts the available hardware from that list.

Just need to use to get the required information for the additional data to include in the PEL FFDC section because that hardware is used to figure out the platform hardware details to callout/deconfigure/guard based on the given hardware procedure error details and should add into the CDG list - This logic will be driven by the PHAL layer, not in the openpower-proc-control.

I would recommend you, "Push as a separate patch with details"

if we push a patch with just removing callout inside hwcallout loop, it will look like hwcallout loop and ffdcs_data loop, both are doing same thing. just logging the data.
i think it will create more confusion to push a seprate commit.

> if we push a patch with just removing callout inside hwcallout loop, it will look like hwcallout loop and ffdcs_data loop, both are doing same thing

No, right? You are going to remove the callout section for the HwCallout list and CDG list will remain the same right? - that's the fix you are trying to do, right?
Done
I think it is just "out" param - looks you are not looking for anything from that parameter.

this function is appending data to existing list. i think we should use [in,out].
if it is only [out], which means this function not guaranteeing to preserve the incoming data.
Ack
Looks extra space please remove it.
Done

JS: Do we need this trace? we can see it from the PEL.

If you think it is needed then, just change it to "Callout the motherboard [{"inventory path"}]" in the trace so that we can use it for any type of error.
I will remove this

Looks not correct , need to have better way to do this . Hwp error's reported by plat function  already have special reason code. I think you are trying to handle i2C errors here. that is non-hwp errors right?
If you add proper RC description that will fix this requirement , no additional chnage required.

Nothing specific clock errors.

this is implemented because of this suggestion
https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/openpower-proc-control/+/49170/4//COMMIT_MSG#57
You could use "!empty()" instead of size() from vector class.
is there any benifit of using it?

Yes, 
- empty() is implemented in constant time regardless of the container type i.e O(1).
- More readability.
Done

Error Type with FFDC_TYPE_HWP already have special reason code for generic Plat failures ( sco/cfam? Am lillle conducesd in additional to that what additional help it is getting here?

I2C failures provided by clock code also will have sub reason code for the eraosn for the failures ? that is capuresd as part of FFDC data ?
Discussed with Ramesh , and this is useful for  displaying cutsom FFDC data logging side related non-hwp plat faiulyres.
